item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Wednesday, April 2, 2025 at 7:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Think I implemented a unique feature in my feed reader (36 points | 14 comments)
2. new state of the art turing test: drawing a rubik's cube (19 points | 9 comments)
3. The April Fools joke that might have got me fired (57 points | 15 comments)
4. Why F#? (23 points | 17 comments)
5. Rockbox 4.0 released (37 points | 10 comments)
6. Who's Hiring? Q2 2025 (43 points | 18 comments)
7. CSS System colors (9 points | 7 comments)
8. 9front “THE FRONT END OF TOMORROW” released (40 points | 10 comments)
9. jj-fzf: Text UI for Jujutsu based on fzf (11 points | no comments)
10. A love letter to the CSV format (27 points | 17 comments)
11. Goodbye Offpunk, Welcome XKCDpunk (12 points | 1 comment)
12. Streaming changes from Postgres: the architecture behind Sequin (6 points | 2 comments)
13. Python Polars: The Definitive Guide (12 points | 3 comments)
14. The Most Amusing Security Flaws I've Discovered (9 points | no comments)
15. Roguetype: The first ever roguelike written in the OCaml type system (4 points | 1 comment)
16. anubis: Weighs the soul of incoming HTTP requests using proof-of-work to stop AI crawlers (8 points | 2 comments)
17. Advent of Code in Coq (2021) (3 points | no comments)
18. Giving up the dylib dream (55 points | 70 comments)
19. My new Emacs (and Ruby) based Static Site Generator (10 points | 4 comments)
20. Pidgin 3.0 Experimental 2 (2.91.0) has been released (16 points | 3 comments)
21. Intuiting TLS (6 points | no comments)
22. CoSy (1 points | no comments)
23. The good, the bad, and the ugly of managing Sphinx projects with Bazel (1 points | no comments)
24. FSKit (14 points | 5 comments)
25. How I Spent Saturday Recovering A Passkey Or Why Open-Source Software Matters (28 points | no comments)
